title: Goldman Sachs Bets Again on VC With Stake in Industry Ventures Management Company
summary: Deal by firm's Petershill unit is its second such gambit, following investment in General Catalyst last year. For the second time in recent months, a unit of Goldman Sachs has acquired a stake in a venture firm.

title: Scientists Restore Some Brain Function After Death in Animal Experiments
summary: The science is still a very long way from having applications in humans, but findings call into question longstanding views of the brain's limits. Researchers have found a way to restore some activity to pig brains hours after death, in a series of experiments that medical and legal experts said could reshape science's understanding of the brain's limits.

title: Getaway Driver in 1981 Brinks Heist Is Granted Parole
summary: Judith Clark, a former Weather Underground radical, spent nearly 38 years in prison for the armored car robbery that left a guard and two police officers dead. Judith Clark, the getaway driver in a 1981 armored car robbery in suburban New York that left two police officers and a security guard dead, has been granted parole after spending nearly four decades in prison, state officials said Wednesday.

title: Publishers Prepare Print Editions of Mueller Report
summary: Expected redactions could cause headaches for typesetters. WASHINGTON-First comes the report, then come the books.

title: This Passover Feast Involves Three Kitchens, 12 Ovens and Lots of Elbow Grease
summary: Resume Subscription. At the Hebrew Home at Riverdale, pulling off one of the biggest Passover celebrations in New York City is an exercise in controlled chaos.

title: Medical Professionals Charged in Opioids Sting
summary: Indictments, which focus on the Appalachian region, are part of a broad Justice Department effort to combat the opioid crisis. Federal prosecutors have charged scores of doctors, nurses, pharmacists and other medical professionals with scheming to distribute more than 32 million powerful and addictive pain pills, including one who traded opioid prescriptions for sex and another who often prescribed drugs to Facebook friends.

title: Peace in the Tech Patent Wars
summary: Apple and Qualcomm settle, and now the FTC should drop its suit.. Good news, there's peace in California. Cupertino-based Apple and San Diego chipmaker Qualcomm on Tuesday declared an armistice in their world-wide patent brawl that was making them and the U.S. less competitive in the global 5G arms race. The Federal Trade Commission should now drop its lawsuit against Qualcomm to prevent more harm to markets and innovation.

title: Trump's Yemen Principles
summary: Congress reminds us why the War Powers Act was a bad idea.. President Trump isn't known for eloquent defenses of his foreign policy, but on Tuesday he stood up for a crucial American principle. His veto of a congressional demand that the U.S. withdraw support from the Saudis in their war in Yemen keeps responsibility for foreign policy in the White House, where it belongs.

title: Another Carbon Tax Defeat
summary: Alberta conservatives oust the provincial left. Is Ottawa next?.

title: The Fed and the Professor Standard
summary: The central bank needs new voices that will speak up for a stable dollar, which leads to prosperity.. Real income for America's bottom 90% reached an all-time high in 1999, and at the time Pew Research found that 81% of Americans agreed that free enterprise was a major reason for the country's success in the 20th century. By June 2015, however, Gallup reported 47% would vote for a socialist.

title: The Longest War Needs Fresh Thinking
summary: Congress should call a bipartisan panel of experts to examine the antiterror effort.. Three American Marines and a civilian contractor were killed in Afghanistan last week, the latest casualties in America's longest foreign war. After almost 18 years of fighting, the U.S. still seems to have no clear goals, no clear measures of success or failure, and no clear prospect of victory in Afghanistan or the broader war against terrorism. To refocus and make good on the nearly 7,000 American lives lost combating this threat, Congress should mandate a comprehensive review of U.S. counterterrorism strategy.

title: 'The Panic of 1819' Review: Easy Money, Bad Decisions
summary: A boom in lending was followed by a bust and hard times. The crisis inspired a new spirit of self-reliance and impressive economic debate.. Few will feel the urge to spray confetti in this year of the bicentennial of the 1819 panic. The wondrous thing, by Andrew Browning's telling, is that the young country survived it. The title of Mr. Browning's fine and formidable history only hints at its scope. "The Panic of 1819" is, in fact, a political, social and financial history of the U.S., before, during and after America's first great depression.

title: Netanyahu Scores Another Victory for Likud's Populism
summary: It wasn't merely personal. The party has been in the Israeli government for 32 of the past 42 years..

title: The Russia Probe Started With the Spies Who Marked Me
summary: The attorney general should question the three men known to have snooped on the Trump campaign..

title: Escape From Collusion Hell
summary: The bet that Mueller would nail Trump didn't pay off. We're left with the rubble.. On Jan. 10, 2017, a news-and-entertainment website called BuzzFeed published the text of the Steele dossier. Simultaneously, most of the U.S. media began running stories based on anonymous intelligence sources suggesting the possibility of a link during the previous year's election between U.S. President-elect Trump and Vladimir Putin. This came to be known as "the Russian collusion narrative." The Steele dossier was the narrative's Rosetta Stone, the reason to believe all the other stories might be true.

title: Notable & Quotable: Fact Check for AOC
summary: 'Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez was pumped to attend a taping of The Price is Right'. From an April 15 "fact check" on Snopes.com:

title: Qualcomm's Bet on 5G Pays Off
summary: Chip maker's lead in nascent technology offered a defense against Broadcom's bid and spurred Apple settlement. Through more than two years of takeover threats and legal strife, Qualcomm Inc. trained its focus on the future promises of 5G. That fixation is paying off so far.

title: Alliance of American Football Files for Bankruptcy
summary: Professional football league seeks to liquidate under chapter 7 after suspending operations earlier this month. The Alliance of American Football, a professional football league that suspended operations after less than two months of competition, has filed for bankruptcy.

title: Chicago Prosecutor Raised Questions About Smollett Case After She Stepped Aside
summary: Newly released documents show State's Attorney Kim Foxx expressed qualms about the case with other prosecutors. CHICAGO-The state's attorney who said she removed herself from the Jussie Smollett case due to a conflict of interest questioned the number of charges approved by a grand jury and reminded the person who took over the case that charges could be dropped under certain conditions, interoffice texts showed

title: How Paris Firefighters Helped Preserve Notre Dame Towers
summary: Decisions to focus on belfries and to dial back water pressure were key to preserving structure and artwork. PARIS-As a raging fire engulfed the wood-and-metal frame atop Notre Dame on Monday evening, city firefighters made a decision that likely saved the structure from complete collapse: They gave up on the roof and turned to saving the cathedral's Gothic towers.

title: Top Silicon Valley VCs Bid Up Email Startup Superhuman
summary: Andreessen Horowitz has beaten rival Silicon Valley firms bidding to lead funding of Gmail challenger. Email startup Superhuman Labs Inc. believes that despite Gmail's dominance, a new player could shake up the decades-old market.

title: Woman 'Infatuated' With Columbine Is Dead, FBI Says
summary: Sol Pais died from self-inflicted gunshot wound following massive manhunt, authorities say. A young woman obsessed with the Columbine school shooting who set off a police search after traveling to Colorado and buying a gun just days before the attack's 20th anniversary was found dead of a self-inflicted gunshot wound, officials said.

title: U.S. Dollar Weakens on Chinese Economic Growth
summary: China's first-quarter economic growth topped many economists' forecasts. The U.S. dollar weakened against emerging-market currencies Wednesday after China said its economy grew at a 6.4% pace in the first quarter, exceeding the forecasts of many economists.

title: Two Female Executives Top Short List For Next JPMorgan Chief
summary: Marianne Lake and Jennifer Piepszak are viewed as possible successors to CEO James Dimon. JPMorgan Chase & Co. put two women with decades of experience at the bank at the top of the list to one day succeed James Dimon as chief executive.

title: When's the Next Housing Crisis?
summary: A decade after the mortgage meltdown, lending gets riskier again.. A decade after the financial crisis, the government still maintains many of the same incentives that drove too much investment into residential real estate. Washington still stands behind mortgage monsters Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac . Mortgage rates remain historically low and recently moved lower. And anyone hoping it will be a long time before America's next housing mania has to be concerned about a revival in a particular type of risky lending.

title: Rideshare Giants' E-bikes Brake With Unstoppable Force
summary: Some users discover Uber and Lyft e-bikes go fast and stop fast, too; 'Just busted my face'. Uber Technologies refers to its pedal-assisted e-bikes as "new mobility," but just how mobile are they?

title: Manufacturers Sue U.S. to Stop Tax Regulation
summary: Lawsuit escalates fight over excise-tax rules affecting wine, spirits companies. WASHINGTON-The National Association of Manufacturers sued the federal government alleging that a tax regulation affecting winemakers and alcohol companies violates clear congressional intent.

title: Trade Wars, Stronger Dollar Crimp IT Spending
summary: CIOs focus on tools and services with potential to drive growth, according to Gartner report. Trade uncertainties and a stronger U.S. dollar are squeezing corporate information-technology budgets, prompting chief information officers to focus IT spending on tools and services with the potential to drive growth, Gartner Inc. said in a new report.

title: Copper Rallies on Strong China Data
summary: Prices up 1.5%, reaching highest level since June. Copper prices rose Wednesday, spurred by signs that China's efforts to spur its economy may be working.

title: Measles Outbreak Upends Passover Traditions
summary: As New York health officials fight outbreak in ultra-Orthodox communities, they predict a rise in cases after the holiday. The growing measles outbreak is colliding with Passover, one of the holiest Jewish celebrations and a time when families travel to be together.

title: E*Trade Profit Jumps, New Users Added
summary: But the online brokerage reported lower commissions in latest quarter. E*Trade Financial Corp. said its profit rose 17% in its latest quarter as a boost in new users of the online brokerage company helped to offset lower commissions.

title: Former Peruvian President Dies After Shooting Himself
summary: Alan García pronounced dead after surgery following incident as officials tried to detain him in corruption investigation. LIMA, Peru-Alan García, a two-time former Peruvian president who played a central role in the Andean nation's tumultuous politics since the 1980s, died after shooting himself in the head as police raided his home as part of a corruption investigation.

title: BNY Mellon Shares Fall as Interest Rates Dent Profits
summary: Flattening yield curve and rising short-term rates leave mark on BNY Mellon's earnings. Bank of New York Mellon Corp. delivered a grim reminder that shifting Federal Reserve policies and softening long-term interest rates are taking their toll on part of the finance industry.

title: Aramco Pursues Stake in Indian Oil Refiner
summary: A deal would help company fulfill goal of matching Saudi Arabian kingdom's production with refining outlets. Saudi Arabia's state oil giant is in early stage talks to take a stake in the Indian operator of the world's largest crude refining facility by capacity, a deal which would help fulfill its goal of matching the kingdom's production with refining outlets.

title: Argentina Seeks to Restrain Raging Inflation With Price Controls
summary: Measures won't remove long-term pressure on prices, some experts say. Argentine President Mauricio Macri introduced measures intended to get the country's accelerating inflation under control after consumer prices jumped almost 5% in March.

title: Health-Care Stock Rout Deepens Amid Political Pressure
summary: Insurers Cigna, Humana and UnitedHealth Group suffer double-digit losses. Health-care stocks are trailing the broader market by a historic margin early in 2019, the latest example of how political shifts have buffeted certain sectors.

title: New York City Extends Order for Mandatory Measles Vaccinations
summary: Order applies to children 6 months and older, with fines for noncompliance. The New York City Board of Health voted unanimously Wednesday to extend an order for mandatory measles-mumps-rubella vaccinations and fines for noncompliance in certain ZIP Codes in Brooklyn, where a measles outbreak began last fall in the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community.

title: U.S. Stocks Pulled Down by Health-Care Shares
summary: Insurers and drug companies have tumbled lately on fears that any tightening of regulations will crimp profits. U.S. stocks edged lower, dragged down by the latest slide in health-care shares, despite stronger-than-expected Chinese economic data.

title: PepsiCo Sales Get Lift From Rebound in Soda
summary: Organic sales rise 5.2%, fastest pace in more than three years. PepsiCo Inc. said a key measure of quarterly sales grew at its fastest rate in more than three years, boosted by a rebound in its namesake soda after the food and drinks giant ramped up advertising.

title: Changing Role of Corporate Compliance Calls for Communication
summary: Bread-and-butter areas of compliance are becoming more complex at a time when new risks are emerging, compliance officers say. The traditional tasks of compliance-minding sanctions, defending against bribery and money laundering-are increasingly complex. Corporate culture and executive conduct are testing compliance officers in new ways. At the same time, the geopolitical backdrop is ever more treacherous.

title: U.S., China Set Tentative Timeline for Next Round of Trade Talks
summary: Negotiators aim for signing ceremony in late May or early June. WASHINGTON-The U.S. and China are planning two rounds of face-to-face meetings as they seek to wrap up a trade deal, with negotiators aiming for a signing ceremony in late May or early June, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: France Debates a Modern Spire for Notre Dame
summary: Competition will address whether fallen spire of fire-damaged cathedral should be restored just as it was or given a new look. The fire that nearly destroyed Notre Dame has presented France with a fundamental choice: rebuild the cathedral almost exactly as it was or update one of the world's most beloved monuments for the modern age.

title: Israel's Netanyahu Looks For Unity After Divisive Election
summary: Prime minister confronts task of sustaining coalition's support as he forms government, faces corruption charges. TEL AVIV-Benjamin Netanyahu said he would use a fifth term as prime minister to unite Israel following a hard-fought election campaign that divided the country over his ability to lead despite looming corruption charges.

title: Oil Prices End Lower Despite U.S. Inventory Decline
summary: Crude also held in check by investor caution before the U.S. decides how to proceed on Iranian oil-sanction waivers. • Oil prices ended slightly lower Wednesday despite a decline in U.S. oil inventories, as investors exercised caution ahead of a Trump administration decision regarding a waivers program on Iranian oil sanctions.

title: Shifts at Gagosian Signal New Direction
summary: Art-world powerhouse Larry Gagosian named a chief operating officer and launched an art-advisory firm. The 73-year-old says innovation, not succession, is on his mind.. Art galleries rarely outlive their impresario founders, but one of the industry's powerhouses-Gagosian-is undergoing some major leadership changes aimed at keeping the franchise on top indefinitely.

title: U.S. Government-Bond Prices End Where They Started
summary: Yields climbed overnight after better-than-expected data on China's economy but reversed as U.S. trading began. U.S. government bonds circled back to where they started Wednesday, having rebounded from overnight losses that followed the release of encouraging Chinese economic data.

title: Ericsson Swings to Forecast-Beating Profit Amid 5G Push
summary: Swedish telecoms equipment company has bet big on the success of new 5G technology. STOCKHOLM-Ericsson AB returned to profit in the first quarter as telecom operators in North America continued to splash out on new fifth-generation networks.

title: In Istanbul, Erdogan Rival Declared Winner of Mayoral Election
summary: T​he​ decision thrusts a​ Turkish ​opposition politician into one of the country's most powerful and prestigious elected seats, in setback for the president. ISTANBUL-An opposition candidate was officially declared mayor of Istanbul on Wednesday, ending President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's quarter-century grip on the megalopolis.

title: At 100, the Los Angeles Philharmonic Is Forever Young
summary: In its centenary celebrations, the orchestra focuses on the musical present and future instead of, as many others do, looking backward.. Los Angeles

title: Neiman Marcus Pushes Into Growing Market for 'Preloved' Handbags
summary: Luxury players are starting to embrace a booming resale market; 'shoppers just want bargains'. The market for secondhand clothing and accessories is going mainstream.

title: Philadelphia Shipyard Fights Again for Its Life
summary: Hit by an order drought, the once-mighty U.S. shipbuilder is cutting staff and needs government contracts to survive. The Philly Shipyard, a remnant of America's former shipbuilding might, is once again on hollow ground with two-thirds of its staff gone, a blank order book and tens of millions of dollars in fresh losses.

title: EU, Canada Vow to Fight New U.S. Sanctions on Cuba
summary: Trump administration decides to allow U.S. courts to hear lawsuits against foreign companies doing business in Cuba. The European Union and Canada said they were prepared to defend their companies' interests in Cuba before the World Trade Organization, after the Trump administration opened the door to billions of dollars in lawsuits against foreign firms that do business there.

summary: The stunning restoration of an epic 1886 wraparound painting, 'The Battle of Atlanta,' goes on view.. Atlanta

summary: Trump administration place sanctions on central bank as part as support of opposition leaders. WASHINGTON-The U.S. Treasury sanctioned Venezuela's central bank and its director in another step to pressure the nation's ruling government into handing over power to the Washington-backed opposition.

title: Trump Administration Offers New Flexibility in Opportunity Zones
summary: Latest Treasury regulations for investing in low-income areas aimed at removing uncertainty. WASHINGTON-The Treasury Department is releasing a new round of regulations for tax-favored investments in low-income areas-aiming to clarify definitions for investors who are seeking to use the tax break, but wary of moving forward without clear rules.

title: Troubled by Debt-Collection Calls? Reprieve May Be Coming
summary: Regulator is set to enhance power of consumers in dealing with collectors. WASHINGTON-Consumers troubled by numerous calls from debt collectors or repayment demands for debts that they didn't know they owed may soon get a reprieve thanks to a planned federal regulation.

title: Libya Fighting Hits Plan to Revive Oil, Gas Industry
summary: State oil company chief says conflict has delayed gas project with U.S. firms, could halt output. LONDON-A fight for control of Libya's capital is disrupting plans to revive Libyan oil and gas production, the country's oil chief said, raising the risk of a global increase in crude prices.

title: U.S. Pacific Commander Seeks More Funding to Counter China
summary: Adm. Phil Davidson sent letter to Senate Armed Services Committee faulting shortage of 'immediate and necessary resources'. WASHINGTON-The commander in charge of U.S. military operations in the Pacific wants Congress to give the command more money for defense programs to counter China, reflecting his concerns that the Pentagon's budget isn't realigning quickly enough to address the threat from Beijing.

title: Uber Nears Investment Deal for Self-Driving Car Unit
summary: $1 billion investment by group including SoftBank would value division at $7.25 billion. Uber Technologies Inc. is nearing a deal with a group including SoftBank Group Corp. that would invest in its self-driving car unit at a valuation of $7.25 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, as the ride-sharing firm readies its initial public offering.

title: PG&E's Path to Bankruptcy Was Paved With $100 Million of Advice
summary: Bankrupt California utility spent big on lawyers and advisers in run up to chapter 11. Before it entered bankruptcy, PG&E Corp. paid more than $100 million for professional advice on how to fend off blame for years of deadly wildfires and, when that failed, how to take cover in chapter 11, new court papers show.

title: Judge Blocks Prosecutors' Move to Release Robert Kraft Spa Video
summary: There is a growing fight over the potentially embarrassing tapes that defense attorneys say were illegally obtained and have become a linchpin in the case. A Florida judge blocked an attempt by prosecutors to release surveillance video showing New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft and other men who allegedly paid for and received sex acts.

title: Fed's Beige Book Sees Slight-to-Moderate Growth
summary: Survey of regional Fed banks also reported moderate wage growth, tight labor markets. Economic activity continued to grow slowly across the U.S. in the spring, but some sectors expected growth to pick up in the coming months, according to a Federal Reserve report released Wednesday.

title: ABB Chief Exits Abruptly Amid Revamp
summary: Ulrich Spiesshofer refocused the company but saw its share price struggle. ZURICH- ABB Ltd. has abruptly parted ways with its chief executive, just months after the European engineering giant unveiled a major new strategy.

title: Judges Approve Settlement Between McKinsey and Justice Department
summary: Consulting firm to pay $15 million as it settles with bankruptcy watchdog over allegations it failed to disclose conflicts. A panel of three judges approved a $15 million settlement between McKinsey & Co. and the Justice Department, resolving the government's allegations that the consulting firm didn't disclose conflicts of interest in bankruptcy cases it helped steer.

title: 737 Max Groundings Drove United's Capacity Trims
summary: Airline may seek compensation from Boeing for costs incurred while planes are grounded. United Continental Holdings Inc. said the grounding of its Boeing Co. 737 MAX jets and the suspension of flights to New Delhi led the carrier to trim its forecast for capacity growth this year.

title: Judge to Hold Hearing Over Alleged Juror Misconduct in Queens Jogger Case
summary: Chanel Lewis was convicted earlier this month in the murder of Karina Vetrano. A state judge on Wednesday said he would weigh whether jurors committed misconduct in the case of a Brooklyn man convicted in the 2016 killing of a woman who was jogging in a secluded Queens park.

title: Trump Donor Faces Second Federal Probe
summary: Businessman whose interactions with Trump's inaugural have been under scrutiny is ensnared in probe examining work with foreign governments. A Los Angeles businessman whose interactions with President Trump's inaugural committee have been under scrutiny is now ensnared in another federal probe that is examining his political donations and work with foreign governments, according to people familiar with the inquiry.

title: Retracing Edith Wharton's Trip to Morocco-For Better or Worse
summary: The Gilded-Age novelist, lesser-known as a travel writer, makes for a beguiling, if contentious guide to North Africa. FROM THE crumbling mausoleums to the minaret-spiked sunset, the overlook just outside Fez was almost exactly as my guidebook described. Any omissions-the couples in search of make-out spots or the Eminem fanboys with tomb-rattling speakers-weren't intentional. The author simply hadn't been here in 100 years.

title: Ron Wyden's Bad Idea for Taxing Capital Gains
summary: His plan will make it difficult or impossible for most middle-class people to accumulate the wealth that gives them independent choices.. Regarding your editorial "Ron Wyden's Plan to Drain Investors" (April 11): For decades, Democrats have loudly proclaimed themselves to be the supporters of America's middle class. Any realistic assessment of their actions, however, shows they have done the opposite. According to Sen. Wyden there are hourly workers who earn wages and pay taxes with every paycheck in one group and millionaires and billionaires in the other.

title: iPhone-Assembly Tycoon to Seek Taiwan Presidency After Consulting Sea Goddess
summary: Foxconn Chairman Terry Gou's run could shake up his company-and Taiwan's relations with China. Taiwanese billionaire Terry Gou, chairman of iPhone assembler Foxconn Technology Group, declared his candidacy for president of Taiwan, in a marked shift for the island's politics, his company and, potentially, relations with China.

title: Shrinking U.S. Trade Gap, China Growth Bode Well for Global Economy
summary: The smaller deficit suggests U.S. economic growth in the first quarter might have been stronger than previously estimated. WASHINGTON-A narrower U.S. trade deficit in February and stronger-than-expected economic growth in China suggested the global economy's outlook may be brightening headed into the spring.

title: On Call With WSJ: Dallas Fed President Robert Kaplan
summary: Central banker to discuss outlook for economy and monetary policy.

title: Give the NRC Credit, It Is Doing Its Job Well
summary: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission has an exemplary record of protecting the public health and safety of the American people.. Regarding the letters of April 11 ("Carbon-Free Nuclear Power Faces Obstacles"): The Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) has an exemplary record of protecting the public health and safety of the American people. For over 44 years, it has taken a conservative view of safety requirements required of nuclear power plants. As an industry spokesman, I often argued against the level of safety being required. The conservative stance taken by the NRC cost the industry a lot of money. Many "How safe is safe enough?" arguments resulted and the NRC could always win these arguments. It was licensing a brand-new technology for the safe benefit of the American public. Other countries followed its lead, and a new energy technology was harnessed for the good of all. The NRC's record of safety is perfect, in that no American lives have been lost.

title: Electoral College and Senate Protect Interests of the Minority
summary: Both were created as a means for the states with smaller populations to protect their interests from the tyranny of the majority.. Karl Rove's "The Lovely but Unloved Electoral College" (op-ed, April 11) largely focuses on the logistical difficulties of removing it. There are, of course, additional reasons for keeping it. First among those is something the Democratic Party has always supported: to protect the interests of any minority. Both the Senate and Electoral College were created as a means for the states with smaller populations to protect their interests from the tyranny of the majority. Would someone please ask the plethora of Democratic candidates how they plan to protect the interests of the minority states?

title: Hockey's Best Team Loses in a Flash
summary: The Tampa Bay Lightning stormed to the NHL's best regular-season record, but were swept by the Columbus Blue Jackets in a historic first-round upset. In the notoriously unpredictable chase for the Stanley Cup, this year's NHL playoffs have already brought a historical level of chaos to the ice. For the first time ever, hockey's best regular-season team got swept in the opening round.

title: Indonesian President Wins New Term, but Challenger Won't Go Quietly
summary: Joko Widodo's nationalist opponent questions the count. JAKARTA, Indonesia-Unofficial results showed Indonesians re-electing President Joko Widodo for a second five-year term, but his nationalist opponent questioned the count, setting up political uncertainty in the world's third-largest democracy.

title: The Non-Liberal Education
summary: Prof. Harvey C. Mansfield's retracted invitation to speak at Concordia University simply underscores how trivial, petulant, narrow-minded and oppressive many in academia have become.. Prof. Harvey C. Mansfield's retracted invitation to speak at Concordia University simply underscores how trivial, petulant, narrow-minded and oppressive many in academia have become ("The Theory Behind My Disinvitation," op-ed, April 15). That they can't see their own contradictions is worthy of a dissertation on irony.

title: Surviving Solo
summary: When a woman is widowed or divorced, she'll face a unique set of financial challenges. Figuring out what to do with the real estate is often the most challenging.. Retirement day should have been a joyful milestone for Nancy Dickenson-Hazard. Instead, she made a heartbreaking decision to stop working and help care for her husband, John, whose Parkinson's disease had advanced to the point that he required hospice care. The following year, in 2015, he died.

title: How Bear Grylls Survives the Airport
summary: The survivalist and host of Nat Geo's 'Hostile Planet' on starting fires, navigating with a compass and the value of AirPods when it comes to catching flights. As a survivalist, I've had to come up with a lot of ways to start a fire. Nothing beats a firesteel. The only problem is you aren't always allowed to travel with it, so you have to pick up a new one wherever you end up.

title: Older People Used to Seem So Odd. Now I Get It.
summary: That's because I do so many of the things I once found strange. Chalk it up to the wisdom of aging. When I was young, I wondered why older women carried around huge pocketbooks, and why public parks had so many benches along their pathways.

title: Fed's Harker: Still Possible for One 2019 Rate Hike, One More In 2020
summary: President of the Philadelphia Fed bank sees job market 'strong,' inflation 'muted,' growth moderate. Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Patrick Harker is sticking with his view the U.S. central bank may be able to raise rates two more times over the next couple of years.

title: The $40 Million Renovation
summary: Resume Subscription. There was a low point about 18 months ago when David Rich-Jones began to wonder if he and his wife Laura had bitten off more than they could chew with an epic project to renovate a neglected Georgian mansion.

summary: The owners of historic Templeton House have spent a decade renovating the 28,000 square-foot-home to return it to its former glory.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

summary: A member of the controversial family is asking $6.495 million for the Upper East Side unit.. David Sackler-a scion of the Purdue Pharma empire who is accused of profiting from the opioid epidemic-is listing an Upper East Side apartment for $6.495 million.

title: A Highflying Growth Strategy Is Paying Off for United
summary: United Airlines hasn't had to slash fares to fill its jets even as it bets big on midcontinent hubs such as Denver and Houston. Airlines cannot easily add scores of seats and still charge more for them, yet United seems to be doing just that. The strategy is risky, but investors may be underestimating its chance of success.

title: U.S. Bancorp to Close Up to 450 Branches
summary: Minneapolis bank says it could cut 450 locations by 2021. U.S. Bancorp could close as many as 450 branches over the next few years, bringing the regional lender's branch count under 3,000, as the company looks to trim its expenses and push more digital tools.

title: As Vietnam Polices Speech, Ex-Cop Thrives on the Art Scene
summary: Mysterious performances attract loyal following; Hanoi's answer to Burning Man. GAM TROI VALLEY, Vietnam-For 18 years, Dao Anh Khanh worked as an undercover policeman, spying on artists and reporting on what they were up to-until, that is, he decided to become one himself.

title: Morgan Stanley's Profit Falls but Tops Expectations
summary: Bank was hit by same trading slump that hurt other Wall Street firms. Morgan Stanley said its first-quarter profit fell 9% from a year ago, hit by the same trading slump early in the year that hurt other Wall Street firms.

title: Can $20K Home-Gym Equipment Entice You to Work Out?
summary: It's shamingly expensive, it's chicly designed, but is it just as ignorable as a clunky gray treadmill? Columnist Michelle Slatalla ponders these questions. MY MOTHER, an early champion of home fitness, swore by an exercise she called "the ankle slimmer." She claimed to have invented it in the 1950s. It consisted of sitting in a chair with crossed legs and making tiny circles in the air with one foot at a time. You can do this while holding a cigarette, or at least my mother could.

title: Face to Face with a Cosmic Wonder
summary: Physicists have been theorizing about black holes for generations. Now science has made it possible to see one.. On April 10, astronomers working with the Event Horizon Telescope unveiled a "photograph" of the monstrous black hole that sits at the center of the M87 galaxy, 54 million light years away. Viewed simply as an image, it is neither impressive nor straightforward: It presents a sort of nondescript, blurry, half-glazed doughnut, showing not the black hole itself but the shadow-like distortion it carves in the surrounding illumination. Yet, to a thinking mind, the image reflects the glory of understanding, and to an alert imagination it opens new portals into space, time and deep history.

title: China's Policy Priorities Deliver 'Front-Loaded' Growth
summary: Beijing starts a year of political anniversaries by choosing expansion over austerity. SHANGHAI-At the start of a politically sensitive year in China, policy makers are promoting economic expansion and putting aside restructuring needed to keep debt from hobbling the economy.

title: What Was Saved in the Notre Dame Cathedral Fire
summary: Some of Christendom's most important relics, such as the Crown of Thorns, were passed along a human chain to get them out of fire's path. Notre Dame Cathedral was home to a vast collection of art and religious relics that came under threat when Monday's blaze broke out. A 19th century clock containing four pendulums was lost to the flames, but many other valuables were retrieved. Here's a look at some of the objects that firefighters, church officials and volunteers saved and ferried away from danger.

title: Marina on Her Musical Rebirth and Shelving Her Famous Stage Name
summary: New name, new perspective: the singer-songwriter formerly known as Marina and the Diamonds talks LOVE + FEAR, Instagram anxiety and the cloistered nature of having a stage name in the first place. Marina Diamandis, the 33-year-old Welsh pop star formerly known as Marina and the Diamonds, has spent the last three years reconsidering-and mostly undoing-some past decisions. 2015's Froot, a quirky album that surprisingly landed in the U.S. top 10, was a critical and commercial success. But after crossing three continents from 2015-2016 with a five-month world tour in support of the album, she pressed pause on her career. "I felt completely untethered," she says from a couch in her label's New York office. On hiatus, she enrolled in psychology courses at a university near her home in London, keeping her fans (slightly) in the loop via a Tumblr called "Marina Book." Its entries were fairly solemn reflections on her state of mind (sample entry: "The Social Stigma of Solitude.")
